page.title: 19NATURAL HISTORY, KNEESALL
page.content: Interviews were conducted with local farmers, a gamekeeper and two ornithologists.There is evidence for a variety of{mammals}living in the arable lands of the 12km block. {Rabbits}are very common. They breed rapidly and are more evident than {hares,}although the{rabbits}do get myxomatosis.There are few{grey {squirrels}and no evidence for{red {squirrels,}as the area is not wooded.Badgers have sets at two sites near the village of Kersall and at Hare Hill, but just outside the "D" block. These are registered sets.Foxes were increasing in numbers with about 20 known in the locality.Other common mammals include{weasels}and{stoats. {
